clinical_study.brief_title: Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) Associated With Postherpetic Neuralgia
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Some Candidate Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and Postherpetic Neuralgia

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Postherpetic neuralgia (PHN) is a common condition and affecting 5 to 30% of the herpes zoster patients. In some cases, the pain remained refractory after first and second line treatment for herpes zoster. This suggests that there may be genetic variants that make some patients susceptible to PHN. Using saliva samples from herpes zoster patients the investigators are going to analyze the relationship between single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in genes that are known to be involved in pain and PHN.

primary_outcome.measure: correlation between pain SNPs and PHN

arm_group.description: Patients who have persistent pain more than three months after the onset of herpes zoster.
Patients whose pain disappear within three months.

study_pop.textblock: Herpes zoster patients in a large university hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age more than 50 years
- Clinically defined herpes zoster patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not able to provide informed consent
